      Source code for pycheron.plotting.basicStatPlots

      import pandas as pd
import os
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

__all__ = ['basicstat_timeseries_plot', 'basicstat_box_plot']


      [docs]def basicstat_timeseries_plot(dirpath):
    """
    Creates a time series plot of basic stats (1 plot per metric) for each station-channel pair

    :param dirpath: directory path to input csv
    :type dirpath: str

    :return: returns time series plot of basic stats (1 plot per metric/station chan) over a given time period within
             the input csv file

    """

    # Obtain network name from dirpath, then grab out list of stations processed
    net = dirpath.split('/')[-1]
    stalist = next(os.walk(dirpath))[1]

    # If css, js, images directories exist in current directory
    if 'css' in stalist:
        stalist.remove('css')

    if 'js' in stalist:
        stalist.remove('js')

    if 'images' in stalist:
        stalist.remove('images')

    # Loop through stations and create html
    for sta in range(len(stalist)):

        # Create a new dirpath based on station directory so we know which chans exist for that station
        new_dirpath = dirpath + '/' + stalist[sta]

        # Get the list of chans for the station, if PSDS directory in the list (which will be for any station that had
        # PSDs run) then remove that item from the list
        chans = next(os.walk(new_dirpath))[1]
        if 'PSDS' in chans:
            chans.remove('PSDS')

        for chan in range(len(chans)):
            # Get channel directory path, then cd into that directory
            chan_dirpath = new_dirpath + '/' + chans[chan]
            os.chdir(chan_dirpath)

            # Load csv file as pandas dataFrame
            basicstat_file = 'basicStatsMetric_{}_All.csv'.format(chans[chan])
            basicStatDF = pd.read_csv(basicstat_file)

            # Convert start_time column to datetime pandas can plot
            basicStatDF['start_time'] = pd.to_datetime(basicStatDF['start_time'])

            # Plot time series plot and save to a png file

            # Create generic title based on loop
            titl = '{}.{}.{} basic Stats'.format(net, stalist[sta], chans[chan])

            # Plot subplot of 7,1, with a shared x axis of start time vs the various basic stats on the y-axis
            basicStatDF.plot(x='start_time', y=['rms', 'standard_deviation', 'median', 'maximum', 'minimum',
                                                'variance', 'mean'], style='.', subplots=True, grid=True, title=titl,
                             layout=(7, 1), sharex=True, sharey=False, legend=True)

            # Save figure to a png
            png_name = '{}.{}.{}scatter.png'.format(net, stalist[sta], chans[chan])
            plt.savefig(png_name, dpi=500)
            plt.close()

            # Cd back into the main network directory
            os.chdir(dirpath)

    return
      



      [docs]def basicstat_box_plot(dirpath):
    """
    Creates a box plot of basic stats (1 plot per metric) for each channel

    :param dirpath: directory path to input csv
    :type dirpath: str

    :return: returns box plot of basic stats (1 plot per metric/chan) over a given time period within the input csv
             file
    """

    # Obtain network name from dirpath, then grab out list of stations processed
    net = dirpath.split('/')[-1]
    stalist = next(os.walk(dirpath))[1]

    # If css, js, images directories exist in current directory
    if 'css' in stalist:
        stalist.remove('css')

    if 'js' in stalist:
        stalist.remove('js')

    if 'images' in stalist:
        stalist.remove('images')

    # Loop through stations and create html
    for sta in range(len(stalist)):

        # Create a new dirpath based on station directory so we know which chans exist for that station
        new_dirpath = dirpath + '/' + stalist[sta]

        # Get the list of chans for the station, if PSDS directory in the list (which will be for any station that had
        # PSDs run) then remove that item from the list
        chans = next(os.walk(new_dirpath))[1]
        if 'PSDS' in chans:
            chans.remove('PSDS')

        for chan in range(len(chans)):
            # Get channel directory path, then cd into that directory
            chan_dirpath = new_dirpath + '/' + chans[chan]
            os.chdir(chan_dirpath)

            # Load csv file as pandas dataFrame
            basicstat_file = 'basicStatsMetric_{}_All.csv'.format(chans[chan])
            basicStatDF = pd.read_csv(basicstat_file)

            # Convert start_time column to datetime pandas can plot
            basicStatDF['start_time'] = pd.to_datetime(basicStatDF['start_time'])

            # Plot time series plot and save to a png file

            # Create generic title based on loop
            titl = '{}.{}.{} basic stat box plots'.format(net, stalist[sta], chans[chan])

            # Plot subplot of 1,7 with each boxplot in one pane
            fig, axes = plt.subplots(7, 1, figsize=(10, 12))
            fig.tight_layout()
            basicStatDF.boxplot(column='rms', ax=axes[0])
            basicStatDF.boxplot(column='standard_deviation', ax=axes[1])
            basicStatDF.boxplot(column='median', ax=axes[2])
            basicStatDF.boxplot(column='maximum', ax=axes[3])
            basicStatDF.boxplot(column='minimum', ax=axes[4])
            basicStatDF.boxplot(column='variance', ax=axes[5])
            basicStatDF.boxplot(column='mean', ax=axes[6])

            # Save figure to a png
            png_name = '{}.{}.{}boxplot.png'.format(net, stalist[sta], chans[chan])
            plt.savefig(png_name, dpi=500)
            plt.close()

            # Cd back into the main network directory
            os.chdir(dirpath)

    return
